reviewText:
Okay, first off, I ordered it near the end of the year, so either December 30th or 31st. Came sooner than they said, which is nice.
I got it about half a month later, and they said it would take about a month to a month and a half. I'm a big Whovian or rather, a big Doctor Who fan.
Along with the fact the women in my family know their jewelry VERY well, like fake jewels and such. So I'm picky naturally I'm picky on both ends.
Anyways, I found it incredibly adorable! A bit heavy, but that's to be expected.
I honestly though that maybe it wouldn't have nice details, considering I got it for about 2 bucks.
They made this piece very cute. However I do see how some would be weary about the gem up top.
Mine was a bit slanted, but since it's so small, you don't really notice it. Even if it came off, I honestly wouldn't care too much.
Though it would've been nice if they had a color option on the gem, since I would've loved to have my birthstone.
But regardless of color options, still cute. And the police box text up top is readable.

If there's any downsides, it would be the chain. I'm not exactly delicate when wearing things, I'm a tomboy. So when I had tugged once, it came off.
Put it back together and it came off again not that long after. Honestly I don't care, since the chain can easily be replaced with a better one.

So overall, I'd recommend this to any Whovian / Doctor Who lover~
But if you have neck or hand problems, the weight not be your thing when it comes to jewelry. Hope this helps others! ^_^
summary: Cute for any Whovian~ Chain is weak, but can change it out.

reviewText:
Just a few points I hope will be helpful. First, this item is coming from China. For those who are unhappy with shipping speed, please try to remember that you are only paying $2.21. You can't possibly expect the seller to send this airmail from China so you will get it faster. If he did that, he'd have to charge a lot more for it. You've purchased it for a song, and part of the price for that is that you'll have to wait for it. It probably took mine six weeks to arrive.

The pendant is very heavy, which immediately made me worry about lead, especially since it was coming from China. I was at the hardware store the day after we got it, so I picked up a lead test kit and swabbed it. The test was negative, so for my pendant at least there was no leachable lead present, at least not at detectible levels. Note that this is not a promise that yours won't be different than the one I received, but I believe mine to be pewter as advertised.

For $2.21 this is a steal, and worth the wait. It seems to be very high quality. The chain not so much, but chains are easy to replace. I bought this for my 10 year old son and he loves it. Hope this helps others.
summary: This item ships from China, but it's worth the long wait

reviewText:
The big three C's when it comes to diamonds - cut, color, and clarity. These babies are gorgeous! Cut is pretty standard commercial round, very clean. Color, even with these advertised K-L, only the slightest yellow. Impossible to notice when my wife is wearing them. Clarity, wow! I1-I2...not milky I3 like many brick and mortar stores around town.

I made the rounds to many local jewelers and big box stores and nobody could touch Amazon's price point for I1-I2 clarity.

Do yourself a favor...and buy these puppies!! You, and your better half will not be disappointed!
summary: These are gorgeous! Wife is thrilled!! Heck of a deal, that nobody local could even come close to.

Really cute hat, fit well. The color was odd I wish it weren't so bright, it has sort of an orange-y hue to it. I was hoping it would be a more neutral color, but it's still a nice hat. Fits great, snug enough to stay on but still has the bohemian kinda feel- in a good way. I've had it for over a year now and it's held up really well- definitely a well made product with quality material and workmanship. I've washed it a bunch- way more than normal, and pleasantly surprised that it's help up so well and still looks so good. A bit of pilling now but honestly I'd expect it to look a lot worse, with the way it's made its not even noticeable though- which is awesome. The only downside for me was the color was a bit more vibrant than expected, which is why I left off two stars, but make no mistake- this is a really good quality product. I wanted a more neutral color, something I could wear with anything and this wasn't what is hoped. I can still wear it with a lot of stuff but since the color is a bit bright I feel like it conflicts with some stuff.
summary: ordered beige got camel color but great fitting quality hat

If you wear reading glasses and have a cell phone, this is a must.  I find myself pulling these glasses out several times a day.  I no longer have to carry reading glasses with me to see the the screen of my phone or any small print.  You will wonder how you got along without this product. Seriously.

When I started getting (ahem) "presbyopia" in my mid-forties, I refused to start wearing glasses, having avoided it that long!  I opted for mono-vision contacts, which have really been great.  I have an iphone and use it all the time.  But when I got my Thinoptics glasses I found out what I had been missing! I  My contacts are great for driving and reading most size text, but with the Thinoptics glasses on my nose, it's far EASIER to see numbers and text on the iphone.  I can have the glasses out and on my nose in a second.  The tiny glasses stay easily on my nose while I use them, and I can return to their hiding place in a second.  A great idea, well done.

I have also had many comments and questions about where to get them.  I hope I have helped some people become customers.
summary: Well worth the money - find out what you're missing!

I purchased 2 pairs of these fabulous glasses last (2014) Christmas, one for an adult child (age 49) who was having trouble making out small print, and another set for me.  He wanted black (because he's cool,) and I got white to go w my iPhone.  I absolutely LOVED mine but, because I ordered WHITE ones, the rims are clear and could not be easily seen if they fell out of their protective envelope - which happened more times than I had ever expected.. They were replaced at no cost in a timely manner.  I had ordered 2.00 strength and I'm going to see if they will replace lost ones at higher strength.
Let me encourage you to select BLACK color as the rims are that color and easily seen.  This product is THE BOMB! and I recommend it heartily w caveat re missing pairs.

reviewText: Can't praise ThinOptics' glasses enough. A pair of my ThinOptics glasses broke, and while I was waiting for the replacements, I realized how much I have come to rely on them. So easy to whip them out when I need to read a menu, googlemaps as I navigate around the city, etc. I use them everywhere! I have the glasses w/ 5s phone case, but will be buying a a bunch of the separate glass cases for Christmas presents. And ThinOptics customer service couldn't be more kind or quick. Rock on, ThinOptics!

Great idea. The case is pretty decent and the glasses don't add much thickness. I prefer a tougher case, however, because I ride horses...but that's just me. The glasses were a little tricky to keep on, but came in handy when shopping, etc, when I just couldn't see. However, they do tend to slip out of the phone case. And alas! That's what became of them. After a few months, I was leaning over the toilet, the glasses slipped out of the case without me knowing...I went to flush the toilet and caught a glimpse of them as they swirled happily down the drain. Bye bye. I put my phone back in my old sturdy case. I won't bother to replace it. But the idea was good while it lasted.

Really disappointed.  The fit of the case for my iPhone 5S sucks. I can't fit my phone in it securely.  When I do fit it in the case forces my mute switch to the mute position.  The glasses seem to be fine but for the price I had rather have a secure case that protects the screen when I lay it down on a flat surface. I went back to my old case since it doesn't make me think my phone is going to fall out any minute.
UPDATE: I eventually used my dremel tool to cut away the phone case from the 'Pocket' that holds the glasses and epoxyed it to my existing case. Now I have a good phone case with the thinoptics glasses attached. It would be nice if the manufacturer offered just the pocket separately. Not as pretty as I would like but I am into function more than form.

Good concept. Terrible quality and zero customer support communication. Saw these online and thought awesome. Got the product. The glasses work pretty good as long as you push them down on your nose. However the case which is a hard plastic started cracking and breaking pieces off about a month after I got it. I don't put the phone in my back pocket or handle my phone roughly.  I contacted Thinoptics customer support by email letting them know what the problem was and even though their site says that they'll respond to you within 48 hours I have never received a response. For the $34 this cost me I would have expected a better quality of product.  Save your money and just buy a cheap thin pair of reading glasses. This isn't worth it.
summary: Great idea. Terrible quaility. Zero customer support response. Broke after one month.

reviewText:
Beautiful Padfolio, smells good, feels better...can't say if this cow, goat, chupacabra, but it is leather of some kind....

The pad that comes with it matches the color as shown in the picture, brown edging - but it has some weird perforation, at first I thought it was defective, and well, heck, it might be defective.  The reason I thought that was the perforations are a little off on the angle, so not perpendicular, and about an inch, inch and a half down from the bottom edge of the binding.  So where one would normally expect to tear a piece of paper off in a nice neat line, this pad will be ragged as hell, crooked and about an inch, inch and a half down from where you would expect.  On that note, it also looks like the perforations were done by hand??  Not sure how to describe it, anyway, the writing pad is a little whack considering how much they charge for this padfolio.

That saiid, I didn't buy it for the writing pad.

The interior is very nice, all leather, even the resume pocket and credit card pockets.

One additional note, when I received this, I thought the person/people doing the assembling had put the writing pad in upside down.  When I opened the padfolio it did indeed appear as though the writing pad were upside down, and I stood there in my living room holding it that way, trying to fathom why someone would intentionally insert the writing pad upside down....  until I slowly turned the padfollio in my hands and walllah, the writing pad is only upside down if it were on the right side, flip the whole thing 180 degrees and  BOOM, you have a left handed padfolio!

GENIUS!!!!

I am much to easily entertained.

I digress, anyway - easy fix for the righty, slide the writing pad out, turn the padfolio 180 degress so the writing pad area is again on the right, and slide it in from the top and now it is a right handed padfolio.

I mention this because it bears mentioning.

I purchased another padfolio from a different manufacturer, and it had that bottom edge sewn up - unlike this one.

So is it a feature?  or???

either way, lefty or righty, your covered with this padfolio.

on another note, it is very well packaged.

It comes in a very clean fiber bag emblazoned with Alpine Swiss logo - that was a nice touch.

And it was then placed inside a plastic bag, then inside a very sturdy white box - then in the shipping box.

I'd say it arrived in great shape.

In the end, I bought this as a gift for my son, so i'm sure he will love it.
summary: Alpine Swiss - very nice padfolio - all leather, inside and out. Left or Right handed writing pad.

reviewText: Classy looking and functional. I'm left handed so I LOVE the ability to flip the paper pad around and write comfortably with it.
Excellent looking ... great purchase!!

What's good...

Came nicely packaged and protected and looks better in person than online.  Bought the lighter brown version and it's a beautiful, deep, rich, British tan color.  Leather quality is better than expected.  Soft, smooth, and shimmering, with light grain and creasing.  Some negative reviews claim it's not real leather.  It's possible it isn't 100% leather throughout (I don't know), but the cover and the interior lining do look, feel, and smell like the real deal. The issue may be the leather seems thin, which makes the portfolio relatively light and the interior pocket a bit flimsy.  It doesn't have the heft or rugged look some expect from  leather.  But that can also be said of more refined leather goods that are more delicate than bulky. So not necessarily a bad thing, really just expectations.  And despite another review's claim, there is a 100% genuine leather tag in the inseam of the inner pocket.

What's bad...

It's smaller than other portfolios.  For reference, within the zippered area there's maybe half an inch of perimeter space around a standard 8.5 x 11 paper pad.  Other's may have an inch or more and could fit all sorts of stuff, but this works fine for notes, standard documents and files.  Size may be an issue when trying to squeeze something larger in there (like a small laptop).

Overall...
I'm happy with the purchase.  Especially around this price point, most other options seem to be "PU" and "pleather," so a leather product, whatever the quality, seems like a reasonable value.  It does have a refined, polished look and feel -- so a good fit if that's what you're looking for.

It's great quality and looks very professional. Only complaint is the zipper closure could have been made better. It's not a deal breaker and it does not happen all the time, but it's not always the easiest to zip.

Excellent product; well made and well priced -

After many years in consumer product marketing I have learned two important concept: a) it is important to undersell and over deliver and b) one satisfied customer may share his/her experience with 2-3 others but a dissatisfied customer will tell 11 others.  This product is worth telling 11 thousand others.

The product description and visuals do not give you a clue about how excellent this portfolio is.  I looked for months at others that cost 4-5 times what this cost and have an old, expensive portfolio (not this brand) that was given to me that does not even come close.

The design is appealing. The leather soft and neatly weathered. I took out the writing pad and use the sleeve for my tablet.  I drop my keys and wallet in one pocket and my phone in another, put in a fat file folder, zip it up and I am out the door.  Neat, practical, cost effective.

Referred it to two friends that have already bought one and am thinking of giving one to the Mrs for B-day.  By the way....This is my first ever review on Amazon, not paid, nor a bot.
summary: The product description and visuals do not give you a clue about how excellent this portfolio is

Lastly, I procrastinate sometimes and I ordered these on June 14th at around 1 pm eastern time and paid for expedited shipping. I like this sweater. I bought the grey also, and they were supposed to essentially be the same size, but they're not. The grey is MUCH shorter, which is why my size 2 daughter is getting it. But the black one is longer, and has no issues covering the butt area, which is how I wear all sweaters. They have to at least cover my butt, ya know?!?
Anyway, I like the thickness of the knit and yarn, and the black is a very deep, dark black. I have always loved cable knit sweaters, but I do wish this had cables on both front AND back.
One last thing- I've seen so many comments on how the ladies don't like the cuffed sleeve, which I understand. As a result of the cuffed sleeve, many are saying the sleeves are too short, the sweater doesn't fit correctly, etc, etc. I have a small suggestion that's super easy to do. If you're able to partially unroll the cuff to the point that you can see where and how it's sewn up you'll notice that it's one single thread running back and forth, and that's it. If you snip the thread in a few places it'll completely come out, and then the sleeve will uncuff. There you have it. No more cuff. No more short sleeves. Now if you want to roll it, you can, but it doesn't HAVE to stay that way.

reviewText:
There are lots of good and bad things about this sweater. Style-wise it is on point. I love the fake leather buttons, patch pockets and thickness of the sweater. Its acrylic, but a modern acrylic, not scratchy at a all. A great wool alternative.
The downsides are poor workmanship. The pockets aren't trimmed out and have large seams that are bulky. One of mine was trimmed a little and the other not at all. One sleeve had a large curve in the stitching which made the inside arm stick out very noticeably. All the seams are sewn to the end of the hems, and not before the cuff and waistband start. It looks altered and not flat.
Those reviews that say the sleeve is short, well it is. BUT it is a drop shoulder seam. If the sleeve was longer, as you wore the sweater the sleeve would cover your hand. If it really is too short for you, unfortunately you can't take down the cuff because it is sewn in one seam.
Size wise, if you are between sizes I would go down a size. It is a pretty open weave and will stretch as you wear it. I am on the curvier hip side, and I could  have easily gone down a size without worry so the bust would have fit better.
It comes from England, so expect it to arrive in about 10 days.
All in all, I am ok with this purchase, because I didn't pay that much.
summary: Sewing flaws, but style and price win out.

Pants wear as great as jeans without the extra weight. The fabric is durable and does not hold wrinkles like 100% cotton. I will be buying more

Fabric is comfortable and they can dry in minutes after being soaked. Heavy duty metal button shows no sign of fatigue. Will buy again to have multiple pairs.

reviewText: Bought more, became my pant of choice. Only complaint is the double knee. Both cloths are the same, so a hole wears at same rate, now dirt gets in, can't get out. Make outside layer out of thicker material and an opening at the bottom for debri to get out. Maybe a flap on top to put a pad in? As is, I'm not sure the double is a plus. You still get a hole in the knee, still looks like a hole in your knee, but now it's full of dirt. Other than that, I like the pants!
I like them better than the dickies ones I got so far
Delivered on time,,great fit,very comfortable

I love my Red Kap poly-cotton shop pants. The material feels cool for all-day comfort. Strong, double-stitched hems and reinforced stitching at every conceivable stress point helps keep these pants intact for the long haul, through the toughest of tasks.

The pants have a zipper fly. There are plenty of spacious, accessible pockets. These functional work pants even have a dual-layer of material at the knees, such that constant crouching is never a tedious effort. Red Kap is some truly accommodating work wear.

I do my own simple to mid-level maintenance, workspace permitting, in my everyday clothes, and I now regret not having had gear specifically tailored to mechanic work any sooner. It makes such a positive difference for myself, and it would certainly make a tremendous difference for any full-time mechanic or anyone else who tends to spend a prolonged amount of time working in the garage. These pants are perfect for shop work, and they are just plain comfortable, too.
summary: Highly Comfortable and Ruggedly Strong Shop Pants

reviewText: The these are great pants for work.  I can use these with a shirt when I walking around the site. They are great if your not to dressed up.well made . Will not shrink in the dryer. Overall nice for work

These are good work pants.  Great for doing construction work, or yard work.  I wore them around my remodel job and they stayed intact and felt durable.  They were a bit longer than I am used to on a 30 in but wasn't too big a deal with boots on.  They don't look that bad either, but they don't necessary look like "going out" clothing.  The quality feels great and I am impressed, despite never hearing of this brand before.
I should have went a size smaller but they are still great.

reviewText: Nice comfortable work pant with extra pockets for your cell phone and other items. The fit is good and the construction is well done. The fabric thick but not too stiff and the waist has must enough stretch that they are comfortable even when bending down. Roomy in the seat. They aren't something you'd wear out on the town, but they are great work pants. Nice quality.
Very comfortable and durable work pants. I have recommended them to coworkers and plan to buy more in the future.

reviewText: These are a great fit for my husband and exactly what he needed to stop getting the oil stains on all his jeans. These are his "garage pants". For all those hours outside working on the boat motor, the lawn mower, the snow blower, etc. They have a comfortable, relaxed fit to them that gives you plenty of room for sitting, standing and moving around in while working. They're made of a strong fabric that doesn't catch on things easily, and there's plenty of pockets for small stuff you're trying to hold or keep track of, your cell phone, wallet and more. And they wash up really well. I've had these through the laundry twice now and they still look brand new, so I can see them him lasting some time. And in case you're looking for a shirt to go with them, my husband has the Red Kap Men's Crew Shirt and it looks awesome with these!
summary: No more oil and grease stains on your jeans

reviewText: These are thick material pants which I expected from a shop pant.  They fit well and had enough give to be comfortable when bending.  I really like that the button is covered with fabric so there is nothing to scratch a vehicle with.

reviewText: These are a great pair of work pants.  They strictly for work.  These aren't slacks you would wear as casual wear.  That said they work great with a polo and are heavy duty.  They are made well and feel like they will last a long time.

These shop pants are a surprise big winner at our house. Very comfortable and look nice, the grey hides dirt well. These are for a male that works in a factory and wears jeans. Currently priced little over twenty bucks and he wants more.this style is relaxed.

reviewText: Needs more taper in legs other that they are fine
fits as expected, good build and very functional pockets. perfect for work but doubtful that they are fashionable enough to get on my hot chicks (or studs your call)

reviewText: Sturdy and attractive, these pants provide both comfort and durability. The stretch waist is forgiving. I loved the reinforced knees. The pockets are generous and functional. The material has a slight stretch. They feel good and look professional. true to size, they are machine washable. They make for a neat and professional appearance. With the comfort of jeans and the practicality of carpenter's pants, these slacks are ideal for work or play.

These are the greatest surprise. I had never heard of this brand of pants, but thought I would give them a try when they were offered on the Vine program. So, I gave them a shot and I can say I am thrilled with them. These are a truly comfortable and well made product. They held up to chore time, and cleaned up well after words. A great product, that is all I can say.
summary: Great pants for the working man

reviewText:
When I first saw these and felt the material, I thought they would be a bit more stiff and uncomfortable/hard to move around in. Turns out they're quite comfortable and there are no complaints with movement. Size 40x34 seemed to be really accurate and actually fit very well. There's enough room in the legs/knee areas to be able to move and crawl around freely without feeling like your restricted, but they're also not baggy looking or feeling. They look really good and fit even better. They are excellent work pants in my opinion and the material is sturdy and feels durable, but not stiff and not uncomfortable. Inner waistband is soft on the skin and has slight stretch - just enough to be perfectly comfortable - they do not stretch out of shape on you and they don't fall down or sag during the day. The pockets on the legs are great for tools or other random stuff you need throughout your work tasks - you could shove a rag or two in there, for example, along with other random smaller items/tools/parts. We will be buying more of these, absolutely.

I have come back several times and bought more of these pants. I think we're up to 7 pairs now. No fading, no shrinking, and still as comfortable as ever. I don't think we will ever buy another brand now.

I've never tried a Red Kap pair of shop pants before; I've always stuck with a pair of Levi's for dirty work. After trying these pants, which were sent to me to review, I've become a believer. These Red Kap pants are securely stitched and the material is very durable. With these pants, I don't worry they're going to split under stress. The black color I have makes these pants better for the workplace than blue jeans are, and they're less expensive than a pair of Levi's.

Reading through these reviews, I see one valid criticism keep coming up -- that the pockets are kind of shallow. It's true that the pockets are not "cargo"-like; they're comparable to a normal pair of jeans. So they are kind of tight if you're used to deeper pockets in baggier pants. Since the pockets are like my jeans, the pockets here don't bother me, but I thought Id mention them.
summary: Solid pants that are great for dirty work

reviewText: These are comfortable work pants.  The fit is good, and loose, which is just what I want.  The coarse material is a bit softer than other work pants I've owned, though I wonder why they can't make work pants out of a material that breathes better.  Any manufactures listening?  These will work fine in the cold, but I suspect that when I build up more of a lather, they will be a bit sweaty.  I do appreciate the attention to detail -- the button cover to prevent snagging, for example, and the pockets which are designed to last.  Over all, a good choice.

These pants are a nice option to jeans. Made of polyester/cotton/spandex, my husband says they are extremely comfortable to wear. He's a solid 41 inch waist, and says the stretch waistband is not tight, but very comfortable. They are definitely not the "work pant" of my father's generation -- these are much nicer and better looking! I washed them prior to his wearing them, and there was no shrinkage. If taken out of the dryer immediately and hung up, wrinkles are negligible. These are suitable for everything from working out in the yard to going out for a casual dinner. Really much nicer than I expected!

These are a great pair of shop pants. Designed more for function than style. The material is thick, and has a somewhat coarse feel to it, but they are still comfortable. The knees are doubled up so they provide a touch of padding, but should last a good bit longer if I kneel a lot while wearing these.

The waist is a bit stretchy. Actually all the material these pants are made from is a bit stretchy, I guess the 4% spandex makes a difference. My first test with a new pair of pants is always to assess comfort at the extremes. So I put them on and then do deep squats. I am talking ass to the ground squats. These pants handle that well. No pinch spots, no choke points. I also did some stretches with my legs wide out sideways and also out far front to back. You know, just in case Ninjas jump out from behind a bush, I need to know if I will be able to kick them in the head. These pants held up well and stayed relatively comfortable. Now I will not really do a lot of deep squats while wearing these, and I do not fight Ninjas on a daily basis, but I need to know the limits of the pants I wear. These passed my test.

The pockets are roomy and it even has a cargo pocket. The stitching seems quite robust and these should provide a good service life for me.

I really love these pants.  They have a really nice canvas-type feel.  The cargo pocket on the left has a great sewn flap-over type design - no messing with buttons or velcro, but still retains your stuff - and the right pocket is perfect for your cell phone and has another pocket I use for my work badge.

The "no scratch" waistband button seems silly to me, and the fact that they're 50+% polyester seems odd for a "shop pant" - I've always heard that polyester melts easily, and I wouldn't want to wear anything that might melt around any work shop I've ever been in.  These pants are kind of like an SUV - they look manly, but you shouldn't try to actually do anything manly in them.

The polyester helps make them a bit cooler than other rugged-type pants that I own.  All around they're one of my favorite pants.

I got these for my husband who is a 38" waist, 34" inseam. These fit him like they were made for him. Generous in the rise without being ridiculously high, he had enough play in these pants to squat and move freely. Love the double knees, the multiple side pockets and the deep front pockets.

These are very stain resistant and wash up beautifully. I like the hidden top button for preventing scratches when he's working on the cars. They also look really nice. My husband associated Red Kap with commercial uniforms but likes these more than other work pants he's favored in the past. 5 stars from our house.
summary: Amazingly well built work pants with great fit.

reviewText: I really like these pants, they are comfortable and fit well and the quality of the material is good.  I wear them for work (Carpenter) and I'm on my knees fairly often so I like the reinforced knees on them.  I also like that they have a pocket big enough for my cell phone.  If the price came down a little (my size is 40 x 32) I'd buy these and the Carpenter jeans that they make and wear them regularly for work.
they are not my favorite but there is nothing wrong with them i am just picky on the fit of what i wear

reviewText:
These pants are nice for light carpenter work, not heavy outdoor framing.. .a big distinction... Red Kap makes heavier outdoor pants...

summary: like a Chino pant, but with all the carpenters embelleshments...

reviewText:
The pockets & fit are a pretty classic twill utility pant like Dickies, but the fabric is half synthetic with bit of stretch, so there's no break-in period, and they're more durable and stain-resistant, but not as soft.

The gusseted inseam give a good range of motion without straining the inseams, and the double fabric at the knees are plus if you're up and down a lot.

Good for medium-duty work pants, nice enough looking for general wear.
summary: Like Dickies with a bit of stretch (and synthetic blend that seems more durable/stain resistant, but less soft)

reviewText: I was initially reluctant to order these pants, because I usually always wear cargo pants, and I don't like to go without the pockets.  To my surprise (maybe I should have read the description or looked at the photos more carefully) these actually have the extra front pockets I like.  There are slash pockets on both sides, of course, but on the right there is also a double pocket where my cell phone fits fine.  On the left there is a flapped pocket ideal for my wallet.  Both of these are below the slash pockets.  These pants also have seven belt loops.  I don't like it when they have only five.  The fabric is not too heavy, but seems really tough, and the knees are doubled.  These should wear well.  The fit is very comfortable.  I ordered my usual size, 38/32, and they fit perfectly.  I am 6'1" tall and 195.  All in all these are an excellent pair of pants, and I will wear them a lot.
summary: Lots of pockets, seven belt loops, and fit perfectly.

reviewText:
These are work pants, not office work pants, but things-could-be-messy pants. If you wear jeans to work (not designer jeans), these would probably be better for you.

As for the fit, I'm wearing them as I type this. I currently wear 34x30 pants (sigh). These fit perfectly fine. I think they'll still fit OK if I were 10 lbs lighter because I am certainly benefiting from the stretch in the waistband.

The color is "navy." I think of this color as air force blue or cop blue. If you've spent time around those uniforms then you know exactly what I mean.

The build quality is pretty good. There were a few threads that needed trimmed, no big deal - see comments on uniforms above. An annoyance, easily solved, is that there was a sizing tag sewn into the outside seam of the waistband. I'd rather not have had to risk cutting or tearing stitches when removing it. The cloth itself is thick and a bit coarse to the touch. It feels like it can take some abuse. The cloth is doubled at the knees, which is nice because it gives a smidgen of padding. These pants have all the usual pockets plus a few "tactical" pockets on the legs. The left side one is particularly large - nice.

Oh yeah, comfort. I've had no problem wearing them for most of a day. They're fine.
summary: Good rugged pants with extra pockets

reviewText:
Ive been waiting for some pants like this for a long time.  Theyre comfortable, with an excellent fit and durable as all get out.  The very first time I wore them was for a massive trash collection event that had me getting in and out of a johnboat and lugging bags of trash through the woods.  Suffice to say, Im more than impressed with the durability of these pants!

As I said, they're nice and comfortable at least for my slightly stocky body type.  Im usually right on the cusp between a 36 inch waist and a 38 inch, with the deciding factor being how well things fit in the seat.  With these pants, I comfortably wear a 36, so my ego is appropriately  pleased as much as my body.  Nice job!

These pants are comfortable and well-designed. The stretchable waistband is a nice feature. Machine washable and sturdy, these are made to last. Was impressed with the quality. Would recommend for sure.

My husband tried these pants and he said they were comfortable. He was able to stretch in them and sit without them riding up. No digging into his belly either. Yet he said the pockets where short and not deep enough, especially the back pocket. He would barely fit his wallet. Also the pockets on the right side were short too but the one on the left was nice because it did have a flap to hold any items he put in the pocket in place.
Ftis as expected. Have been using these for a few years now and they last!

These are absolutely comfortab.e and they look sharp even if they are work pants.  Importantly, they are durable.  Tough, that's the word.  For me, they're suitable leisure slacks too.  They're also great gifts for brothers and sons.  I truly prefer these to Dickies.
summary: Preferable to Dickies, in my mind

reviewText:
These are exactly what I have been looking for.  They have cargo pockets and the right side is setup for carrying my cell phone!  They are extremely comfortable, fit well and the details of manufacturing are superb!  You will not be disappointed in these.  The price is amazing for what they are.  I will be ordering more!

*** April 2, 2016 Update ***
I wanted to share that I have been wearing these daily and have many wash cycles on them and they are holding up beautifully. The color looks as good as the day I purchased them.  I have a told of four pairs now.  Truly worth the 5 star rating.

*** April 18, 2016 Second Update ***
I ordered two more pairs of these and I had to send them back.  The hem on the pants was not finished.  See attached photo.  I had given 5 stars as I had posted earlier however felt I had to lower to 3 stars due to a quality control issue with my recent order.

*** April 19, 2016 3rd Update ***
I received replacement for the two pairs that had issues.  Both of the replacements are fine.  No problems, I'm a happy camper once again.  Stars moved up a notch to 4 stars.
summary: Phone Pocket!  I've Been Waiting For This! They Look Great, Fit Great and Feel Great! I Love Them!

reviewText: These are fantastic. The material is thick and durable, resistant to rips and tears. The fit is great. Plenty of pockets for tools. My only complaint would be that they are a bit warm wearing, however, if you want something that is thick enough to not rip easily, it's going to be a bit warmer.

These are shop uniform type of pants, they are made for heavy rough use and designed for industrial washing with chemical washing treatments for removing tough stains. They can be washed in a home washing machine too but pre-treat ground in grease and oil stains for best results. Made in Mexico the fabric is on the stiff side but does fave spandex to give the fabric some give, after washing they loosen up a little but not like cotton Jeans.
summary: A good strong industrial made pant that are on the stiff side but made to last hard daily use with many washings.

reviewText: These are nice, sturdy pants. I found no problems when examining the seams, and they are a comfortable fit.

reviewText:
Wow... I have been buying "the other guys" work pants for years. When I tried these, I was skeptical. I am a man of larger carriage and have problems with the crotch of pants being snug. Not with these pants! not only do they have a slight stretch to them, they have a little extra room for my... well,... they're just comfortable.  So comfortable, in fact, I would wear these any day of the week. The stitching is industrial and thick. Even double stitched in certain places it needs it.
  The sizing is accurate. the front button is covered so it won't get snagged on anything. These pants are really thought through well.pockets are secure and the material of the pants is thick. perfect for winter. I have yet to work in these in the summer months, so I'll  update this post then. Overall, I purchased another pair of these pants and probably will not go back to the other major retailer of workpants.
summary: Tough, thick and comfortable... just like me.

only had them on one day -- the fit is perfect for my overweight body -- big stomach,  not so large legs -- I have to wear suspenders due to my shape - no hips to hold pants up -- seem like they will hold up in physical work environment -- comfortable stretch -- fabric is a course weave maybe a little more so than painters or Carhartt material -- will be ordering more

I am very glad I read the reviews and decided on this Alice costume. It fits me perfectly (I'm about 125 lbs, 5'3") but my favorite part is that this dress is an appropriate length. Still short but I could bend over without my whole booty falling out. The fit is not skin tight  but is snug and cut correctly which is nice because after all that Halloween candy I need a bit of wiggle room (don't we all?). I love that the neckline is high and that this is an actual Alice costume- not an opportunity to dress like a "you-know-what" and get away with it, just because it's Halloween. As others have mentioned, the sleeves on this dress do make arm movements slightly limited. But unless you're playing volleyball in it I don't see it being any sort of problem. My favorite part is the apron. It really is adorable and looks just like the picture when it's on.

This dress is so cute! I was in desperate need of an Alice costume for my sweet 16th (it was Disney themed) and thank God I chose this one. It arrived early, which is always a nice plus. I was so excited when I received this in the mail that I just sprinted back home from the mailbox. I tore the package open and immediately put it on and fell in love right away. The dress itself is really comfortable and a pretty light blue color. I especially love the lacey part at the bottom of it. The apron was a little complicated to figure out at first, but once you put it on once you'll get the hang of it. This dress is even cuter than the pictures and I'm glad I bought it. Even after the party, I'm planning on wearing the dress once summer comes back around as I love dressing up in cute lolita-like dresses, and this dress is perfectly acceptable to just wear around in public. Sadly, I took off one star as the collar is quite tight around my neck and I always have that faint sensation of choking every time I wear it. It's not unbearable, just sort of uncomfortable. But other than that, this is the cutest thing ever and I highly recommend to anyone looking for an Alice costume (especially if you're in a rush). Thank you guys again for the fast delivery!

For reference, I am 5'5", 130lbs, with measurements 34-27-35.

Good purchase, modest yet cute design; don't buy any other Alice costume if you can fit into this one.

No need to purchase a petticoat, as the material underneath "poofs" out the dress. I am 5'3 120lbs and this costume fit me like a glove. I have never received so many compliments on a costume. Super cute and perfect weight for warmth! We live in CA so the weather here is far from frigid but keeps my baby warm enough for our winters here. My baby is 26lbs and 32" tall and the medium is big on him but not too big to where it poses a problem, he just has room to grow. He still is able to stand and move around freely and the legs stay on the ankle, never falls down which is nice. However if you wanted to pull the legs over the feet for extra warmth, you can do that too. I only give 4 stars because once it's zipped up to the top, the fabric flap that covers it is small and bulky but doesn't seem to bother my baby as he sleeps and he mostly sleeps on his stomach. The zipper is fully covered though and doesn't scratch at all. I guess the flap bothers me more than him so with that being said, I'd still purchase this again...way better than the Halo version!!!

reviewText: Very good quality knitted item. I like that it can be worn in different ways to add flair to an otherwise plain shirt or dress. It is made like an oblong shawl, but it has long cuffs to be worn around the wrists to keep it all in place. No slipping off the shoulders like many shawls will do. My only (slightly) negative comment would be that I would like it to be a bit longer since I am larger than the model in the picture. Perhaps the supplier should make these wonderful, cuffed wraps in differing lengths to accommodate different sized bodies.

I read mixed reviews on this before I decided to buy... hard to figure out and whatnot. Yes, it takes a bit of getting used to but once you figure it out it really is a great layering piece. One thing to keep in mind is your frame, I am 5'10 so in order for me to wear it comfortably and achieve a good look my sleeves are more 3/4 length sleeves. This is not a pull it out of the package and wear it piece but if you are willing to invest some time (it took me about 30 minuets) to learn how to wear it... you will like this.
summary: It took some time...but worth it.

Arrived over 20 days than what it estimated. And it's really small, like it does not cover your face. Not like the picture at all. I've never left a review for anything before but this sucked so bad that I had to.

My expectations weren't very high due to the price. I knew I'd be getting something cheaply made but I didn't expect it to be this bad, even for the price. The most egregious part is the lace. Not only does it not partially cover the eyes as shown in the photos, it doesn't even come half way down my forehead. So wearing it makes it look like I have little short bangs instead of lace draping down. It wouldn't have cost that much more for them to make the lace front as long as it is in the picture. The headband itself is also very tiny, looks to be a child's headband.

Additionally before even unwrapping it the lace is coming apart from the wire ears and headband. There's also strings of glue from the hot glue gun all over it. This I would have been able to work with and fix up had the lace at least somewhat replicated the photos.
summary: Don't waste your money... even if it's only 5 dollars.

reviewText: Like other reviewers experienced, the veil isn't anywhere near long enough on the one I received. It doesn't even reach my eyebrows. What is even the point then?? The lace is pretty, but the raggedy seams are visible on the backside of the ears. But since it's black, it's not too noticeable. I mean, I wasn't expecting superior quality for under ten bucks, so I'll let that slide. However, the shortness of the veil is a huge letdown.
summary: Order with caution! Veil is not long enough.

reviewText: This lace bunny ear headband blew my boyfriend's mind last night when I paired it with my lace crotchless full bodystocking that I also purchased from Amazon. We don't roll play often so I figured it was time for him to get a special treat so went not.  He smiled like a kid in a candy store the whole time. He said the veil was sexy and mysteries. When these plugs first arrived i was very happy with them. They looked nice, especially for the price and were very wearable. The problem started, however, only a couple days into having them. The Gold pair of tunnels that i had got completely stuck in my ear. Thinking, it was a problem simply with how i screwed it on and continued fiddling with it in my ear with hopes of getting it off. After an entire week, i finally caved and went in with a piercer to have her remove it. The removal took FOUR hours, the piercer was completely stumped as to why this had happened, the screw was on the tracks fine, like they were supposed to be, the piercing was just unfathomably stuck. Then, after going home and looking at the jewelry a second time, the screw got stuck again! I would not recommend this product unfortunately...

This purse is a medium brown (has an orangish tint to the synthetic leather) and has a really nice smooth, shiny look to it which makes it look expensive.

It came in a dust cover bag which is a nice way to store the bag in my closet when not using it (very nice presentation from the shipping box).

There's no frayed stitching anywhere on this bag. It's really well made and the paneled stitching in the front is done very well. I like how they did it in black to give it a nice bold two tone look. The two zippers alongside the paneled stitching are both functional but are really there as a fashionable accent.

It comes with a detachable strap which is nice for when your bag is heavy with stuff and you want to throw it over you like a cross body bag. It can be used as a handbag or a shoulder bag.

The inside is pretty standard like most handbags with 1 side zipper, 1 middle zipper which can help divide surrounding stuff you may have in this bag, and 2 side pockets. The side pockets are a little bit on the small side which can make for a tight fit if you have a newer smart phone.

The care instructions state "Do not expose to rain and sun." So this bag is probably not going to get much use in the winter time. All in all, this is a really cute bag and would make for a great gift. I know I'll be getting a lot of use out of mine.

NOTE:  I received this product in exchange for my honest review.
I got the bag today as promised and it's blew my expectations. Its soft and cute. I can use it for church or work.

This is a nice purse to take to meetings, lectures, etc because it is reminiscent of a briefcase and you can easily put tablets, folders and notebooks inside, (It is more of a stiff-sided bag rather than a floppy one.) It's a great size for everyday carrying, not too big that it becomes cumbersome to carry and not too small that you can't fit anything in it. The color of the "brown" purse is more like a cognac color, more on the orange side of brown. It includes a shoulder strap that you can use instead of the carrying handles, which is a nice option. As any nice purse it came with a dust cover and each handle was protectively wrapped in plastic and the feet were covered in tape to prevent scratches. Those attentions to detail are all signs of good quality. The zippers on the front are decoration only, they provide a nice detail but do not open up to expand the bag or have secret pockets. Every other zipper is functional. The liner is a durable dark brown and is a good color and material for keeping the bag looking nice inside (easy to clean, dark enough to not show stains.)  I do not know if this is actual leather, it feels like vinyl, but it is still attractive and nice-looking. The stitching is pretty good (about 98% perfect) and any flaw I noticed was only detected because I looked extremely carefully at it, definitely not noticeable unless you are looking for it. The black edging is done well, they did a very good job on it. It is comfortable to carry and looks smart, I look forward to seeing more from this company. I am pretty picky when it comes to my handbags and I am looking forward to using this one, especially with the "patchwork" trend being on point this season.
(This sample was provided for testing and review purposes.)

This is a beautiful hand bag. It is smaller than I expected from the picture. It is big enough to hold a small tablet. It comes with several pockets to store your things. There is a main zipper pocket in the middle and an open compartmebt on either side. One of the open compartments has two smaller open top pockets. An iPhone 6 will likely be too wide to fit in the smaller pockets, my iPhone 5 fit inside it ok. There is also a small zipper area on the outside of the bag. You can choose to use two handles or one strap that is included. The leather is smooth and high quality. This bag is easily comparable to Gucci and Guess handbags I have owned in the past. I imagine the fabric and leather will hold up well over time with normal use. *I received this product free for review.

reviewText:
Synthetic leather or not, I love the look of this bag!  Yes it's a bit stiff when you first get it and the exterior zippered pockets are more fashion than functionality, but it's definitely an attention getter.  The brown color is actually a warm, light umber and it's nicely contrasted by the stitching and pieced together style.  It is large enough to carry my wallet, tablet, cosmetic bag and other misc items, but not so big that I find it uncomfortable to carry.  It appears very well made and a closer look at the stitching show no defects or misses.  Obviously this is not an everyday bag, but even with regular use I believe it will last with care.  The price point on it is just about right in my opinion for the quality and materials used.  I also like that it arrived in a dust cover bag, which is great for storing it in.

*Sample received for unbiased review.

reviewText:
I was hesitant to purchase this, but I'm quite fond of it! The colors are brighter than in the picture, more red and purple and bold. Not soft colors like the photo. I've been wearing it with a lace tank under and it's super flattering. I thought I might look like Mrs. Roper (you have to have watched 3s company to get that reference) but I've been getting compliments on it and people asking where I got it. I always am worried that I look fat, but this is actually pretty flattering. I've worn it with tight black pants and skinny jeans (I'm not), and it's flowy and forgiving. For my body type, this really works well and I'm digging it.

Note that it's a lot of fabric, super big. I typically wear a woman's size L and this is big on me, which I like. It's like a pretty tent that falls nicely. There is colorful trim on both the neck and at the end of the sleeves.
summary: Lovely Blouse that Goes Over a Tank (TANK NOT INCLUDED)

I used to have a ACM wallet and actually got many compliments, but it started breaking down where cards would slide out, so I found this wallet. The Secrid wallet is on a whole new level, it looks amazing, feels really great, its actually metal as opposed to plastic of the ACM wallet. It is extremely thin and fits into my pocket very easily. The clear slide on part is useful for carrying cash and other cards. I can fit more than 10 bills inside easily plus an insurance card. It is also removable so you can just carry the metal cardslide itself if you want. It looks like it should last a long time and the mechanism to push the cards out works very well. You can see them fan out really nicely while being held on tightly so that nothing falls out. I have not tried out the RFID blocking capability yet.

One thing to note is that the paint can chip off (1 star off), I had my keys in the same pocket as the wallet and can see a slight chip. Not too big of a deal, but it can happen. I also bought the red band for a different look as seen in the picture. I hope to use this for a long time. Would definitely buy again.
summary: Awesome wallet, very slim and feels really nice.

reviewText:
After contemplating shelling out $150 for two slabs of carbon fiber, screwed to a rail, and held together with an elastic band, I decided to see what else was out there.

While the Secrid is pricy, at about $60 with the Cardslide, it's quite a bargain compared to other minimalist wallets.

Materials and construction are top notch. The card eject mechanism works well, and it feels nice in the hand.

Size for just the Cardprotector is great. I could probably even sit on it without much discomfort. The addition of the Cardslide makes the unit about as bulky as a leather trifold, without the "give" a flexible wallet provides. So leaving it in your back pocket is not comfortable for driving or working at the office.

If you plan to carry it in a front pocket, I don't think it would be as much of a problem, depending on how tight your skinny jeans fit. I keep my phone in my front pocket, so keeping the wallet in my left front would be awkward for me.

I have an NFC type parking pass, and since the aluminum Cardprotector is rated to protect against information theft, I tried to keep the parking pass in the plastic Cardslide.

Apparently the signal has some trouble escaping even the plastic, as I have to hold up my parking pass for an awkward amount of time, before the gate rises so I can enter the garage.

I just recently tried holding my parking pass to the exterior on the other side of the wallet, so just the elastic band touches the card, and the parking card is not inside of the unit at all. (See photo)

So far, even this does not trigger the gate to rise as fast as holding just the card up to the reader. I don't know if the aluminum is somehow disrupting the signal from my parking pass, or what.

I hope to find a solution, because I'd like to keep my parking pass with my wallet, so I can swap between driving my truck and my motorcycle to work, without worrying about if I left my parking pass with the other vehicle.

Overall, a cool product. I hope to figure out a solution to my issue, so I can use the Cardprotector for years to come.

(I assume within 3-5 years we won't need wallets at all.)

Though I will probably ditch the plastic slide, and just use the Cardprotector by itself, to save on bulk in my pocket.

I recommend getting one, but see if you can pare down to just the Cardprotector before spending the extra money on the Cardslide version.

UPDATE: I made room for my parking pass inside the Cardprotector. I positioned it so the parking pass was the tallest card in the stack when the cards were ejected. That worked very well when exiting the garage yesterday.

TIP: If you stack two embossed cards (raised numbers) facing each other so the numbers don't cause any extra thickness,  you can get an extra card in the Cardprotector.
summary: Outstanding, if you do not keep it in a back pocket when seated.

reviewText: Very nice material and fits more cards than most wallets.

This Alpine Swiss Men's Genuine Leather Hipster Bifold Wallet is a large, high-capacity, and exceedingly versatile wallet. It features ten card slots, two oversized pockets, and two separate bill sections, presumably for the purpose of separating small-denomination bills from large-denomination bills. It is an incredibly well-designed, well-organized, and spacious wallet, which can readily accommodate a driver's license, other types of identification cards, credit cards, insurance cards, business cards, and a generous amount of cash. In addition, it is characterized by an understated and attractive design, as well as strong and durable construction. Also, it represents an excellent value at the price point at which it is being offered. This outstanding Alpine Swiss Men's Genuine Leather Hipster Bifold Wallet features a minimalist and attractive design, decidedly efficient and practical organization, and impeccable construction and quality, and I give it a five-star rating, along with my highest recommendation.
summary: Superb Alpine Swiss Men's Bifold Wallet, which is Large, Well-Designed, and Versatile, and Characterized by Impeccable Quality

reviewText: Loved my Vera Bradley! 2 outside pockets and 6 internal pockets!

I love this tote!  First, it has an 11 inch drop on the handle which means that it fits comfortably over the shoulder. I have found that even a 9 inch drop brings it up too close under the arm.  It does have a "hard" base to stand up but it is itself quite lightweight.  When you pick up before we stuff all of our stuff in there, it does not weigh much at all.  Nicely made with one exterior zip pocket and one exterior tuck pocket.  Inside has a variety of pockets including one where we can put our gigantic iPhones.  I can comfortably fit two sets of keys, one phone, one big wallet, one cosmetic case, my sunglasses and regular glasses.  Still room to put in small purchases or notebooks as examples.  Watch out though because they do sell a bigger one and I saw that at a Vera Bradley store and it was huge--I am reasonably tall and I would have hesitation on that. I also saw in that same store the navy blue and the beige one.  Nice colors. I purchased the black.  I really like it.
summary: A perfect tote: not too big, not too small

reviewText: I looked for a bag like this for a long time and finally found it, the perfect travel bag -- big enough to carry all my stuff, yet light weight and attractive.  Love it!  Finally Very Bradley figured out that not everyone wants flashy fabric patterns.  This bag is classy and classic, with six roomy inside pockets and two large outside pockets.  The handle length is great too, long enough to carry comfortably on my shoulder.  Top it all off with a zipper the protect your stuff and you're set to go.  Perfect!
summary: Classy, Classic and Light Weight.  Love it!

reviewText: This is a beautiful bag.  I have several Vera bags and the Mandy has been my long time favorite.  This has the same spacious interior and pockets that I love. When I entered into manhood, my Uncle Alfredo shared with me that great virility is a dual-edged sword and must be wielded with great responsibility.

I listened carefully to my uncle because I knew he was not as lucky as I to have someone share this cautionary advice with him. You see, as a young man he and his virility traveled the perilous road of amore. When you travel such a road, you need to think about protection and Im not talking about latex. What I speak of is known as the cornicello or little bull horn. When you have had as many spurned lovers as Uncle Alfredo, you most definitely need to wear one to ward off the evil eye.

I was hoping to get a necklace with a 3 inch cornicello so I can display my virility to the world while protecting myself from the evil eye. My wife had other ideas so what I got instead, free in exchange for this unbiased review, is the Bamoer cubic zirconia white Gold plated round halo pendant necklace.

When I first saw this necklace, I knew my wife would love it. My wife prefers small dainty jewelry and, as I predicted, she loves this necklace.

The circular pendant is beautiful with a very classy looking design making it perfect for that big night out. It also looks great with jeans and a sweater so it works for more casual outings as well. The stones maybe cubic zirconia but they have nice clarity and really sparkle.

The only negative thing I found with the necklace is the chain. It seems a little too delicate to me and seems to be prone to knotting. It isn't a big deal to my wife though. She says these are the types of chains you get in this price range and the knots are easy to undo so that is not an issue for her.

If you are in the market for inexpensive jewelry, you can't go wrong with this necklace. It is a high quality piece and is much nicer than necklaces I've seen in this price range.

All of the metal is plated with white gold to give the stones an extra bit of sparkle.

This is a BIG watch, although it's not as large as the men's atomic watch that I have. I wish it showed seconds, but I can live with it not. I don't particularly care for the pink color, but it's the only women's atomic watch I found. I replaced the pink leather band with a Timex Men's Q7B749 Stainless Steel Expansion 16-20mm Replacement Watchband, which fits perfectly and looks great.

Update 3/8/2015. Says it updates automatically for Daylight Saving Time. Mine hasn't and it's almost 5 PM. Need to dig up the instructions and see if there's any setting I can try.

Update 4/30/2015. It did eventually update for DST. I'm not sure when because I didn't wear it for several days after DST commenced, but when I put it on the following Wednesday, it had updated. The update problem could have been because I was in a low-signal area, but the other three atomic clocks at that location did update properly.
summary: Larger than I'd like, but it's atomic

reviewText: My primary reason for getting this watch was because I have a newborn baby and I've realized it's really useful to have the time ready available, my cell phone wasn't going to cut it. I usually don't wear watches because I'm not a fan of analog and all the digital watches I've seen are very sporty looking. I wanted a digital women's watch that looked casual. I owned one once before from Tommy Hilfiger and it was complete crap. Never worked even after replacing the battery on it twice so I assumed I was out of luck until I saw this one. Gotta say I love the watch...I had the same issue as others mentioned where the watch was 15 mins delayed but after letting the radio signal do its thing, it updated in 24 hours. I left it face down next to a window at night per instructions. They mention night is the best time to update because there is less interference and since I'm up all night anyway these days I did a couple of manual tries and I got it. The watch is very sturdy a little thick but not bad at all compared to sports watches. Really happy with this one
summary: exactly what I was hoping for

reviewText: It's everything I wanted in a simple atomic wrist watch.  Furthermore, Klockit has fantastic customer service-- a few months after I purchased this I realized I misplaced the directions, so I emailed them and they sent me the instructions within the day!
summary: Great watch, even better customer service

reviewText: The best watch I've ever owned. I never have to worry about changing the time since it is automatic. Great feature!  Affordable price adds to the reason for buying.
summary: The watch of the future is here and this is it.

reviewText: I love the watch and wear it every day
Looks good.  I hope it works when time changes in the Fall.

I had to use the very short user's guide to set the watch.
I do not like it when a button has to be held for a few seconds. It is not intuitive and you do not know what will happen nor will you remember what to do next time.
The watch did not and does not have the exact time, it is slow by five minutes. I tied to have the watch set it self and cannot get it to set the exact time or receive the signal. It will indicate it is trying to get the signal. One or two signal strength bars may show. What makes it worse is that there is no way to manually adjust the time or at least the instructions does not mention how to do so.
April 9, 2015, the watch now has the exact time, it took several day, I am not sure what day the watch set it self.
The main time cannot be set to no Day Light Saving Time. We do not have DST in Puerto Rico.

It has the date but only in numerical format I cannot stand that. Today is 09- 4, is the month September or April and the day the 9th or the 4th?
The month should have the option to be Apr-09, it does not have that option.

I wish it came with a metal band. I plan on replacing the band.

The watch is big for a women's watch.
Ordered: March 28, 2015
Arrived: Saturday, April 4, 2015
In Puerto Rico
summary: Auto Time took days to set

reviewText: I received my Ray-Bans 3025/112-69 Orange/Red Mirrored Aviator Sunglasses order 3 days before the end of Amazon's arrival estimate. They seem to be true authentic Ray-Bans; as to markings/etchings, glass/metal materials, included docs, case itself and its gold foil stamp, but the box's UPC sticker is unlike the 6 others of Ray-Bans I've ordered in different lense colors from various sellers on Amazon and eBay, this being the third in this particular Orange/Red color. After seeing this, I admit, I was a little skeptical, but since it's the glasses I'm more interested in, that's alright with me. They are very sturdy and a definite orange/red mirror, which is the best colored lense in my opinion. All in all, great purchase and price ($89.99/Free Ship-Rec'd on Dec. 15, 2014) from SunsetDeals. (But now I'm seeing that a day after receiving them in the mail, the price now is $124.95/Free Ship through SunglassLife, which is too much in my opinion.) In conclusion, I definitely received a better deal. Thanks, SunsetDeals, I'm very satisfied with my purchase.
summary: Authentic Ray-Bans 3025/112-69 Orange/Red Mirrored Aviator as far as I can see.

reviewText:
Great bag! It's a little small, though, but a nice, leather bag, that easily fits my 11' Macbook Air. The leather material feels fancy and as someone starting a new job, I felt comfortable with this as a professional bag that was also simple and surprisingly cheap! It is a little small, but not so small that it looks purse-like or anything.

The other thing is that the laptop sleeve on the inside is well padded and has a top stretchable velcro strap, which is great, but definitely couldn't fit much bigger of a laptop. Of course, this is fine for me with an 11'' Macbook Air, but I could imagine others might be annoyed with the smallness of the pouch.

A note about the strap: it's adjustable, but definitely on the short side, so a very tall person might be annoyed by it, but it worked perfectly for me.

The clasps on the front flap are magnetised and snap in well also.

Pros: great material, great price, formal without being expensive
Cons: a little smaller than I expected, short strap
Bottom Line: Great bag. I'm very happy with it!
summary: Great bag! Slightly smaller than I expected though.

reviewText: i like this bag, because is very light end comfortable

Recently out of college I still carried around a backpack to work. I realized it didn't look professional and wanted to do something about it.
It took some serious research into finding the perfect bag while at the same time not breaking the bank. Bags of similar design, granted not the same quality, we're ranging anywhere from $200-$300 . I didn't feel ready to plop down that much money seeing as Id never owned a messenger bag before. I went with this bag mainly because of price but let me tell you something, WOW!
This bag is exactly what I was looking for and much more. It looks premium built, holds all that I intended to use it for, and it receives compliments.
I've only had it for a few weeks now so I'll see how it holds up in time but I am expecting to have it for a long time. I don't carry much around with me, just my iPad, MacBook Air 11inch, water bottle, and a few little items. The bag is a little on the smaller side but I only needed it for my MacBook Air so it perfectly fit my needs.
Everyone where I work has asked where I got it from and how I paid for it. It's definitely an eye catcher and will give you the professional look you so desire!
summary: The perfect bag to spice up your look!

reviewText: It is so unique and one of a kind. Fit nicely and looks expensive.

Im a huge Disney fan who loves everything Disney. I love to wear Disney jewelry but its hard to find jewelry thats not childish that is affordable. I purchased this item along with three other Disney inspired jewelry. I love it. I was so excited when it came. It was delivered in just a few days after I had purchased it and I couldn't be more pleased with the quality. The ring itself is made on sturdy metal and holds up to most daily activities and doesnt turn my finger green. I wear it at the hospital I work and Im constantly using hand sanitizer or washing my hands. This ring has held up through all of that. The ring size is true to what I ordered. I love the fit of this ring. My fingers are on the small side and this ring isn't so big that it feels and looks oversized on my finger. I would definitely recommend this ring to anyone that loves to wear Disney inspired jewelry. Its even small enough that older kids could wear it in a small size. Well done to the designer of this ring. Its something a little different. Ive had several compliments on it and some have asked me where Ive gotten it. I was give this ring at a free or reduced rate in exchange for providing an honest and unbiased review.Women's Gold Plated Mouse Infinity Knuckle Midi Ring

reviewText:
This is the only bowling bag I've ever bought that was big enough to fit an actual bowling ball in it, haha. This is HUGE! More like a hobo bag than a handbag or purse. With some padding, it could easily double as a laptop bag, overnight bag, diaper bag, or if you need a bag big enough to carry a small dog around in. But it's awkward to carry around as a normal handbag, especially if you wear it on your shoulder, resting in the armpit/breast area, and it does not come with straps so that you can extend the length and have it rest lower on the body (like a hobo bag/tote bag/messenger bag would).

It's also not of very good quality. The exterior of the bag is a fabulous fake leather and I couldn't be more pleased aesthetically, but the straps feel thin and flimsy (especially considering the size of the bag itself...I don't imagine these straps would last long if you actually filled the bag), the inner lining is cheap, and 2 of the zippers came off track just while I was inspecting the bag (a problem I had with a bag I purchased previously by Banned, so I think this is just a terrible designer).

If you're looking for a very large, occasional use bag, then this is great. But it's a little cheap and awkward for everyday use.

First thing - the material isn't canvas. It is more of a "plasticy" type of material. Also, when I got the bag, there were some issues with the zippers, but they disappeared after working the zippers for a while. Based on other reviews, it seems like a common problem.

Apart from that, I loved the bag - it has a good number of compartments, and they are very spacious. If not packed, the bad doesn't look very big, but you can definitely get a lot in there if needed. Including regular-sized magazines. So, despite of the disappointing surprise with the material, I decided to keep it.

I have A LOT of these handbags, and I mean A LOT!  This is one of the nicer ones because (1) decent price and comes in gray, (2) the zippers match the bag instead of the giant pale gray zippers frequently used on every bag color to save money, (3) holds a lot without looking like luggage, the bottom of this bag measures 11.25" X 4.25" and it arrived much much sooner than promised.  No problem with the lining getting caught in the zippers either.
Now you should know that this is not a designer bag.  It seems to be sewn "well enough", however, the front flap is slightly crooked as is the zipper on that flap. (People who would be bothered by this, probably aren't buying inexpensive bags from China.) Like all nylon bags, it wipes up easily with a damp cloth.  The pockets are large, even the one on the face of the flap and the one on the back.  Not overly crazy about the big zipper pulls, but that's not a deal breaker.  The handle strap is highly woven nylon, not that loosely woven cotton that looks "ratty" after a while.  All said, I am pleased with it enough to want it in other colors.

reviewText:
Others are correct, they run small. My size matches the bottom of the height and weight range for the 1x size so I bought that (no larger size available). I can pull them on but it is a squeeze. No one at the upper end of the stated size would be able to wear these.
They are nice looking and would be warm to wear without being bulky. I won't return them, I like them enough, but wish they were a little bigger for a better fit and more comfort.

I wasn't going to write a review at all, but then they contacted me to ensure I liked them. I said that even though I ordered a M/L for my 5'6" and 120lb frame, and I pulled them (stretched them) as much as I could, the crotch sat about 1" below where it needed to be. Thus, You feel a web between your legs when you are walking. Not comfortable. When I replied to them saying the above, they responded with "Maybe you need to order a size 1x." I was shocked. No offerings of a replacement- just them saying I need to order another pair. and I'm sorry, in what world do we live in that a person with my small frame (petite even) would wear a size with an X after it? Poor customer service at this company- save your $ and buy elsewhere.
summary: BAD customer service- IF you want to walk with a web between your legs buy these.

Product is as described

this tem shipped right away, I got it as soon as promised. it is good quality and it fit good. I am a size xl in clothes if that will help anyone else with sizing. the tie string is super long so there is plenty to tie with. the clasps in front stay put which I thought would pop open as soon as I sat down. I would say it is a good price for what I got. I've been wearing it for a week about 6 hours a day and I can already see a difference in my waist. (:

I purchased this corset as a waist trainer, and I absolutely love it. I've never bought one before, so for my waist size (39") I decided to play it safe and get the 36". I plan on purchasing the 32" version in a few weeks.

It fits perfectly, and after only a few days of wearing it I am able to tighten it all the way. I've worn it 4-8 hours every day since it arrived (7 days so far) and can already see a difference in the size/shape of my natural waist and tummy.

The corset itself has a beautiful design, is very sturdy, and all of the boning is steel. I've seen reviews of other corsets that are listed as steel boning but only have it in the front with the rest being made from plastic or other flimsy, bendable material. So I was relieved to find that mine came as advertised. The strings are made from a thick, shoe string-like material that is very sturdy. I can pull on them really hard and tight without fear of breaking.

It's really very comfortable once you get used to wearing it and figure out how to move in it. You won't be able to bend at the waist, as is expected, but it's not impossible or awkward to pick things up off the floor. It helps with posture training as well, which is great for a sloucher like me.

Another bonus is that it looks freaking SEXY! I won't go into detail, but I will say that my husband absolutely loves it. It even looks amazing under clothing. I wore it under a tight fitting shirt to work yesterday, and it's very discreet and unnoticeable. I received compliments from co-workers and customers, most of them saying, "That shirt looks amazing on you!" They had no idea that it wasn't just my choice in clothing making me look good.

TL;DR version: In short, I love this corset. It's gorgeous, comfortable, and discreet. It's perfect for waist training, wearing under clothing, and for costumes. It's amazing, and I highly recommend it.

This product is well made, question the product description of steel bones, the bones are way too flexible to be steel, but the product is very nice anyway.  It is sized a bit small, the notes say order 4" smaller than your waist, but that will be too small and the length is very short, barely makes it to my waist let alone over for full training.  Makes my waist curve very high, up into my ribs rather than below.  The product is nice and I will wear it, I just really desire a trainer much longer and will continue to look for one longer to become my go to piece.
summary: but the product is very nice anyway. It is sized a bit small

reviewText:
Many customers are exaggerating that a size small is like a size large or extra-large. It is not. I ordered a size large in order to ensure it would fit my 36C bust and it fits slightly loose. A medium would probably fit but be slightly tight. It measures similarly to flowy camis I have in size L or XL. I'd recommend ordering based on your normal size taking bust into consideration.

Otherwise, I think the garment is decent quality for the price. The hem and sticking aren't perfect but it doesn't seem like it's in jeopardy of falling apart. I will probably hand wash or throw it in the wash with my delicates. It's semi-sheer. I tried on the pink top with a black bra and the outline was vaguely visible but not so see-through that it looks trashy. A nude or pink bra should work fine. The cami is slightly cropped but meets my waist (and I'm 5'9").

Overall, if you'd like to have a fashionable top for the right price, I'd recommend it. I plan to wear it when I go out or during the day time with layers to make it more appropriate. It came in about two weeks and since spring it rolling around the corner, I may purchase one in another color.

Before you order, be sure that you know where your "natural" waist is.  That is where this skirt is meant to sit, not at a lower place on your body where the waist of modern pants sit.  This is a beautiful, vintage inspired skirt with a traditional waist, not a modern low rise like the pants we all wear now.  That said, the size of pants you wear will not be the same size you need in this skirt; you need to keep in mind that your natural waist (above your belly button) may be bigger than where your pants sit.  In my case, I ordered up a size following all of the reviews and the skirt was way too big because my natural waist is slender and more around the size of my pants waist, if not smaller.  If you have a little extra in your stomach area, size up. If not, the skirt is true to size.
